As the beleaguered defenders attempt to hatch a plan of escape for 
themse=
lves, and as the sweeps press their advantages from above a 
change appears=
 to come over the battle. The sweeps move swiftly into 
the air, rising abo=
ve the level of the immediate battle lines, almost 
as if calling for a cea=
se fire, or at least a temporary cessation of 
combat. ((OOC: although they=
 will keep firing if fired upon)) 

All too quickly the reason for the ceas=
e fire becomes all too 
apparent as the large form of Cyclonus in his dread=
ed spaceship mode 
seems to almost materialize out of the clouds, flanked b=
y two of his 
new minions: Tumult and Decibel. 

Cyclonus looks like he has=
 fared well with the power of the matrix 
and has been transformed by it! L=
ooking larger, well armed and 
armored, any sensor directed at him might pi=
ck up another startling 
change. He is powered not by the nuclear power of =
the engines of a 
previous incarnation, or even the fusion power of his las=
t meeting, 
but the full power of something akin to antimatter, and his wea=
pons 
match! 

"You have fallen far too easily Cybertronians!" Cyclonus' vo=
ice 
thunders out over the battle field, "I must admit I had not expected 
=
it. Perhaps you were not worthy of my full attentions."

Even as Cyclonus t=
alked the sweeps took up formation around him as he 
began to rise higher i=
nto the air ((OOC: assuming no one is attacking 
them)). "It would seem tha=
t your brethren at the Ark were more 
successful than you at thwarting my p=
lans, I will be forced to take 
matters in hand."

It is obvious that Cyclo=
nus is about to leave . . . 

(Tag or TBC)

Preston
